page.title: 09DUPATH AND HARABEARA
page.content:
{ Dupath Well}dates from the 15C. A stone-built chapel covers the spring, which was once believed to cure the whooping cough. The site is an{Ancient Monument}now in care of English Heritage{(Historic Buildings {& Monuments Commission).
{ Harabeara }is a medieval manor house now largely in ruins. It was renamed West Harrowbarrow when the estate was divided.
{East Harrowbarrow}is now the village of Harrowbarrow, and THE FARM is probably the original farm holding of the divided estate.
